context_menu.windows package¶

Submodules¶

context_menu.windows.advanced_reg_config module¶

context_menu.windows.advanced_reg_config.command_preset_format(item: str) → Path to desired python type¶

Converts a python string to an executable location.

For example, ‘python’ -> sys.executable

context_menu.windows.advanced_reg_config.context_registry_format(item: str) → registry path to the desired type¶

Converts a verbose type into a registry path.

For example, ‘FILES’ -> ‘*shell’

context_menu.windows.advanced_reg_config.create_directory_background_command(func_name: str, func_file_name: str, func_dir_path: str) → Registry valid string to call python function¶

Creates a registry valid command to link a context menu entry to a funtion, specifically for backgrounds(DIRECTORY_BACKGROUND, DESKTOP_BACKGROUND).

Requires the name of the function, the name of the file, and the path to the directory of the file.

context_menu.windows.advanced_reg_config.create_file_select_command(func_name: str, func_file_name: str, func_dir_path: str) → Registry valid string to call python function¶

Creates a registry valid command to link a context menu entry to a funtion, specifically for file selection(FILES, DIRECTORY, DRIVE).

Requires the name of the function, the name of the file, and the path to the directory of the file.

context_menu.windows.registry_shortcuts module¶

context_menu.windows.registry_shortcuts.create_key(path: str, hive=18446744071562067968)¶

Creates a key at the desired path.

context_menu.windows.registry_shortcuts.delete_key(path: str, hive=18446744071562067968)¶

Deletes the desired key and all other subkeys at the given path.

context_menu.windows.registry_shortcuts.is_admin()¶

Returns True if the current python instance has admin, and false otherwise.

context_menu.windows.registry_shortcuts.list_keys(path: str, hive=18446744071562067968) → List of keys¶

Returns a list of all the keys at a given registry path.

context_menu.windows.registry_shortcuts.run_admin()¶

If the python instance does not have admin priviledges, it stops the current execution and runs the program as admin.

context_menu.windows.registry_shortcuts.set_key_value(key_path: str, subkey_name: str, value: Value, hive=18446744071562067968)¶

Changes the value of a subkey. Creates the subkey if it doesn’t exist.

context_menu.windows.windows_menus module¶

class context_menu.windows.windows_menus.FastRegistryCommand(name: str, type: str, command: str, python: function)¶

Bases: object

Fast command class.

Everything is identical to either the RegistryMenu class or code in the menus file

compile()¶
get_method_info()¶
class context_menu.windows.windows_menus.RegistryMenu(name: str, sub_items: list, type: str)¶

Bases: object

Class to convert the general menu from menus.py to a Windows-specific menu.

compile(items: list = None, path: str = None)¶

Used to create the meun. Recursively iterates through each element in the top level menu.

create_command(name: str, path: str, command: str)¶

Creates a key with a command subkey with the ‘name’ and ‘command’, at path ‘path’.

create_menu(name: str, path: str) → Path to shell key of new menu¶

Creates a menu with the given name and path.

Used in the compile method.
